page.title: 08Clubs & Sport in the Cowtons
page.content: There are a variety of clubs for young and old in North & East Cowton. Girls of seven can join the Brownies held in term time at East Cowton. At ten they can graduate to the Girl Guides, also in East Cowton. Six year old boys go to the Cubs held in North Cowton, but have to leave the area to continue with the Scouts in Scorton. In North Cowton there is a flourishing Womens Institute which meets monthly in the Village Hall. Occasionally the 40 members have bus trips but usually they invite visiting speakers to their meetings. In East Cowton there is the Yorkshire Womens Association which meets monthly in members' homes. In East Cowton there is a Gardening Club, Football and Cricket Clubs, over 60's club and weekly Youth Club. Events are often organised by an elected Sports & Social Commitee.
